conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the paths of the liquids A, B, and C.
Liquid A (Blue) flows down from the top.
Liquid A moves downward and is directed by the diagonal purple baffle.
Liquid A flows towards the right side, avoiding container D and heading towards container E.
Liquid B (Yellow) flows down from the top.
Liquid B encounters the same diagonal purple baffle.
Liquid B is split, with some heading towards the middle but continues primarily to the right.
Liquid B flows towards container E.
Liquid C (Cyan) flows down from the top.
Liquid C follows the path alongside liquid B.
Liquid C flows directly towards container E.
Based on this analysis, all the liquids (A, B, and C) are directed along paths that lead to container E.
Final Answer: The liquid will flow into container E.
